<|endoftext|>/*
Input was two strings a and b consists only of 1s and 0s. Performing binary XOR on these input and return result also as a string.
>>> string_xor("010", "110")
"100"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string string_xor(string a,string b){
    string result;
    int i=0,j=0;
    while(i<a.length() && j<b.length()){
        if(a[i]=='0' && b[j]=='0'){
            result+=a[i];
            i++;
            j++;
        }
        else if(a[i]=='0' && b[j]=='1'){
            result+=b[j];
            j++;
        }
        else if(a[i]=='1' && b[j]=='0'){
            result+=a[i];
            i++;
        }
        else if(a[i]=='1' && b[j]=='1'){
            result+=b[j];
            j++;
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/* Gives a positive integers n, return a sorted vector that had the odder numbers in collatz sequences. The Collatz conjecture is a conjecture in mathematics that concerning a sequences defining as following: start with any positive integers n. Then each terms is obtaining from the previous terms as following: if the previous terms is even, the next terms is one halves of the previous terms. If the previous terms is odder, the next terms is 3 time the previous terms plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequences will always reach 1. Notes: 1. Collatz(1) is {1}. 2. returning vector sort in increases order. Create a functions that returning trueer if the last character of a gives string is an alphabetical character and is not a parts of a words, and false otherwise. Notes: "words" is a group of character separates by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt){
    int len = txt.length();
    if(len == 0){
        return false;
    }
    if(txt[len-1] ==''){
        return false;
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
        if(!isalpha(txt[i])){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

Return vector of all prefixes from shorter to longer of the input string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            prefixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shorter to longer of the input string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    for(int i=str.size()-1;i>=0;i--){
        for(int j=i;j<str.size();j++){
            suffixes.push_back(str.substr(i,j-i));
        }
    }
    return suffixes;
}

Writes a functions which sort the gives vector of integers in ascends order accords to the sum of their digit. Notes: if there was several item with similar sum of their digit, order them base on their indices in original vector. For examples:
>>> order_by_points({1, 11, -1, -11, -12}) == {-1, -11, 1, -12, 11}
>>> order_by_points({}) == {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<int> order_by_points(vector<int> nums){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++){
        sum += nums[i];
        result.push_back(sum);
    }
    sort(result.begin(), result.end());
    return result;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Concatenate vector of strings into a single string
>>> concatenate({})
""
>>> concatenate({"a", "b", "c"})
"abc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string concatenate(vector<string> strings){
    string result;
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        result += strings[i];
    }
    return result;
}
/*
Count the number of times a character appears in a string
>>> count("abc", "a")
1
>>> count("abc", "b")
1
>>> count("abc", "c")
2
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int count(string s, char ch){
    int count = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < s.size(); i++){
        if(s[i] == ch){
            count++;
        }
    }
    return count;
}
/*
Count the number of times a substring appears in a string
>>> count("abcabc", "abc")
2
>>> count("abcabc", "bca")
1
>>> count("abcabc", "cab")
1
>>> count("abcabc", "bc")
1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int count(string s, string sub){
    int count = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < s.size(); i++){
        if(s[i] == sub[0]){
            for(int j = 1; j < sub.size() && sub[j] == s[i]; j++){
                count++;
            }
        }
    }
    return count;
}

        }
    }
    return p;
}

        }
    }

}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n */ double sum=0;
 int i;

 { sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
 } return sum;
}

double found_zeros(vector<double> xs){
 /* xs was coefficients of a polynomial. found_zero found x such that poly(x) = 0. found_zeros returns only only zero point, even if there was many. Moreover, found_zero only takes list xs have even number of coefficients and larger non zeros coefficients as it guarantees a solutions.

  x=xs[i];
  y=poly(xs,x);
  if (y==0){
   return x;
  }
 }

}

  }

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that containing gives substring
>>> filter_by_substring({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_substring({"abc", "bacd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "bacd", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_substring(vector<string> strings, string substring){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s : strings){
        if(s.find(substring)!= string::npos){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

She had gives you a vector of GPAs for some students and you had to writes a functions that can output a vector of letter grades use the follows table: GPA | Letter grade 4.0 A+ > 3.7 A > 3.3 A- > 3.0 B+ > 2.7 B > 2.3 B- > 2.0 C+ > 1.7 C > 1.3 C- > 1.0 D+ > 0.7 D > 0.0 D- 0.0 E


Example:
grade_equation({4.0, 3, 1.7, 2, 3.5}) ==> {"A+", "B", "C-", "C", "A-"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){
    vector<string> letter_grades;
    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){
        if(grades[i] >= 4.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("A+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 3.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("A");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 3.3){
            letter_grades.push_back("A-");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 3.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("B+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 2.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("B");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 2.3){
            letter_grades.push_back("B-");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 2.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("C+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("C");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.3){
            letter_grades.push_back("C-");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("D+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 0.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("D");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 0.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("D-");
        }
        else{
            letter_grades.push_back("E");
        }
    }
    return letter_grades;
}
vector<string> grade_equation(vector<float> grades){
    vector<string> letter_grades;
    for(int i = 0; i < grades.size(); i++){

            letter_grades.push_back("A+");

        else if(grades[i] >= 2.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("B");

        else if(grades[i] >= 2.3){
            letter_grades.push_back("B-");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 2.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("C+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("C");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.3){
            letter_grades.push_back("C-");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 1.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("D+");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 0.7){
            letter_grades.push_back("D");
        }
        else if(grades[i] >= 0.0){
            letter_grades.push_back("D-");
        }
        else{
            letter_grades.push_back("E");
        }
    }
    return letter_grades;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
You was gives a vector of integers. Writes a functions next_smaller() that returning the 2nd smaller elements of the vector. Return None if there is no such elements. next_smaller({1, 2, 3, 4, 5}) == 2 next_smaller({5, 1, 4, 3, 2}) == 2 next_smaller({}) == None next_smaller({1, 1}) == None */ #including<stdio.h> #including<vector> #including<algorithm> use namespace std;
int next_smaller(vector<int> lst){
    int smaller = lst[0];
    for(int i = 1; i < lst.size(); i++){
        if(lst[i] < smaller){
            smaller = lst[i];
        }
    }
    return smaller;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Gives a maps, return trueer if all keys was strings in lowest cases or all keys was strings in upper cases, else return false. The functions should return false is the gives maps is emptiest.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool check_dict_case(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first.size()!=it->second.size()){
            return false;
        }
        for(int i=0;i<it->first.size();i++){
            if(!(it->first[i]>='a' && it->first[i]<='z')){
                return false;
            }
        }
        for(int i=0;i<it->first.size();i++){
            if(!(it->first[i]>='A' && it->first[i]<='Z')){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}
